question: Which are the lactate isomers?
ideal_answer: Lactate contains a chiral carbon and thus has two optical isomers-d-lactate and l-lactate.

snippets.text: D(-) and L(+) lactate isomers produced by Lactobacillus spp
Lactate contains a chiral carbon and thus has two optical isomers-d-lactate and l-lactate.
Mucosal cells of the gastrointestinal and female reproductive tract are constantly exposed to l- and d-lactate of bacterial origin.
